newsitem.title: UK: UK'S ITC SETS TERMS FOR 'BUNDLING' REVIEW.
newsitem.headline: UK'S ITC SETS TERMS FOR 'BUNDLING' REVIEW.

text.p: Britain's Independent Television Commission (ITC) said on Monday it would look at arrangements for sports and movies as part of its review into the 'bundling' of pay television channels.

The ITC said it was also investigating whether the wholesale price discount structure for British Sky Broadcasting Group Plc 's premium channels could prevent the entry of other providers into the market. The probe has been requested by the European Commission following a complaint from cable companies.
The ITC, which last month said it was extending its competition investigation into premium channel bundling, issued a consultation document on the matter on Monday.
Bundling refers to the practice by which pay operators such as BSkyB sell channels in packages rather than on an individual basis.
The ITC plans to look at issues such as how digital television will affect competition in the pay TV market.

Other issues include how to define a premium channel and whether different considerations should apply for movie and sports channels. It will also look at whether current arrangements for basic channels increase choice for viewers.
